Recipe.Title: Cream of Asparagus Soup
Recipe.RecipeIntroduction: Recipe by Kraft This simple but elegant soup is a must-try. The texture becomes smooth and silky with the addition of cream cheese. Perfect as is or served with whole wheat rolls and a mixed green salid.

ToolTip.Text: Olive oil is recommended, but other oils or butter are fine.

RecipeStep.StepText: Chop up 1 large onion, and mince 1 small garlic clove
RecipeStep.Title: Chop onion & mince garlic

RecipeStep.StepText: Trim and chop 1-1/2 lb (675g) asparagus spears
RecipeStep.Title: Trim & chop asparagus

RecipeStep.StepText: Heat 1 Tbsp. oil and 1 large chopped onion in a large saucepan on medium heat for 5 minutes, stirring frequently
RecipeStep.Title: Heat oil & onion

RecipeStep.StepText: Add 1-1/2 lb. (675 g) trimmed chopped asparagus, 1 minced small garlic clove, and 2-1/2 cups chicken broth to the saucepan/nBring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Then cover and simmer on medium-low heat for 15 minutes, or until vegetables are very tender.
RecipeStep.Title: Add mix to saucepan

RecipeStep.Warning: Oven mitts are recommended for handling the hot pan
RecipeStep.StepText: Transfer the mixture to the blender in batches, blending it until smooth.
RecipeStep.Title: Blend mixture

RecipeStep.StepText: Return the mixture to the saucepan. Add 3/4 cup cream cheese and 1/4 cup milk. Stir on medium heat 2 to 3 minutes, or until cream cheese is completely melted and soup is heated through.
RecipeStep.Title: Return mixture to saucepan
